reviews.review: BioShock Infinite is the best BioShock experience you will even play. Packed with a greatly executed, mind twisting story, you will have an amazing experience. By far one of the best storys in a video game.
An interesting story, but boring game play. Really only good ofr the first hour or so and the last 20 minutes.
Great, love all the Bioshock games. However I did feel the atmosphere was better within Rapture.

This is an excellent game for 20$. You might still be quite happy at 30 on the other hand since the storyline is quite interesting if not captivating at time. Fun gameplay. Different level of challenge but honestly it's a bit short like most games these days. Took my 20 hours to go throught it without much difficulties but the replay value is there mostly if you play on a big screen tv.
Swinging on SkyLines and ZipLines :D
Great
melhor jogo de 2013 :)
Great atmosphere, superb graphics, lovable characters, and a really, REALLY deep and complex ending.

I was very slow boat to the game because everyone kept saying how awesome it was.  I really wish I would have listened and played it when it came out.  I loaded the game and played it start to finish in 1 10 hour sitting haha.

I really loved the early 1900s clothing, music, and steampunk machines.  They did a really good job making it feel like 1912, and not like you were playing a game pretending to be an early 1900s game,  The random NPC chatter was funny and I felt like stopping and listening to them all talk.  I didn't skip any of the Kinetoscopes either.  I really liked the movies!  They reminded me some of Myst and the mini movies you got in that game.

Good action, great story line.  The ending threw me for a loop.  Now, I want to play it again to see if anything else clicks during the storyline.  Overall an A+ game!
Total MindF.u.c.k O_O.... SO AMAZING
Beutiful graphics, and incredible storyline, and memorable characters. A must-have for anyone that loves a good twist.
amazing , just no more to say . by far he best game i have ever played

Se quiser comprar um jogo e se divertir com certeza Bioshock Infinite é o melhor!

A game with explosive gameplay that might not always be perfect, but the story and characters overshadow any flaws and lets you immerse yourself in a compelling world and a worthwhile experience.
Such a great game!

Possibly the best FPS single player campaign I've ever played through.  Rarely a dull moment.  Once it gets going, you're not going to want to stop until it's finished.  Then you'll probably want to play again.
Klasse Spiel. Sehr sehr gute Story und klasse wendungen. Beim Steam Winter Sale lohnt sich das Spiel erst recht für 15€. Total Empfehlenswert! Ein must-have!

Such a great game. I'll try to be brief in my explanations;
1. Great characters
2. Great storyline and the history behind the game is awesome.
3. First bioshock to be outside, very bright colors, refreshing.
4. Gameplay uses the core mechanics of bioshock and still managed to improve them.
5. SALTS!
왜 속편이름이 Infinite인지, 플레이 해보면 알 수 있을것이다.

Although not as good as its predecessors Bioshock 1 and 2 this game is indeed a beauty to look at, experience and explore through. Fast paced action that can sometimes prove quite challenging until you've found the right strategy to counter the foes. They've built in side quests that will require you to revisit places you've aleady been but for some reason I found this kind of tedious rather than adding extra spice to the game. I also have to admit that the longer the game progressed it got difficult to keep up with the stroryline and where it was actually leading the main character and unless you are fluent in the English language you're most likely not going to be able to enjoy much of its complicated twists. Still, well worth a playthrough but if you haven't played Bioshock 1 and 2 yet you should start from the "beginning". Rapture is really quite a beauty to visit!

Kinda a linear shooter as opposed to Bioshock 1's open levels. Even though combat may get a bit tedious and repetitive, there's always all kinds of stuff you can use to kill you enemies (vigors, vigor combos, weapons, vigor and weapon combos). Columbia was just so awesome to look at! The scenery is amazing. Plus, the story. It's mindblowing (especially the ending). Play it. Seriously. Another great game in the Bioshock series.

Visually fantastic and a great story with very interesting but controversial themes. Combat is just a bridge to the next piece of story and is a bit weak in that aspect however it does not detract from such a great game.

Boy oh boy, do I regret waiting months after release to finally experience this. BioShock Infinite is a beauty of a game with an amazing setting and gameplay, beautiful graphics, and an engaging story. Combat is fast and frantic, and works wonderfully. Highly recommended to ANY shooter fan, you will not be disappointed.
Das  beste Spiel das ich je gespielt habe

Believe everything that you have read! Bioshock Infinite really IS that great. Bioshock Infinite encapsulates beauty in many forms. Whether that be the beuaty of the world that the game is set in. Whether it be the understated beauty of its story. Or whether that be the beauty that is found at the heart of the relationship that is formed between the two main protagonists. 

The story is masterfully crafted, and contains more twists and turns than a rollercoaster. Ironically however your journey throughout Bioshock Infinite could be likened to a rollercoaster as you are never left to wander in a straight line for long. You are constantly moving on to other bigger better twists in the road and it is a journey that every gamer should experience. No matter what your personal preference is, Bioshock Infinite has something for everyone.
Good game, Once you start it's hard to stop playing, very good value for money.
História fantástica. Qualquer coisa a respeito dela é spoiler. Não leia nada a respeito e jogue para um maior aproveitamento. E prepare-se para ficar uma semana tentando entender.

One of the best worlds in gaming history, a deep story with interesting twists that is undermined by collectable story queues. The combat is lacklustre at best with limited guns that aren't very unique, the vigours do help add a little spark to the combat. A game that feels like a great story broken up between hoard-mode shooting every ten minutes.
Shooter im  Jugendstil-Ambiente und intelligenter Story. Absolute Empfehlung!
Good game, good story. might be more interesting if the choices had more impact
One the best games ive ever played, very innovative, brilliant story, excellent action and incredible fun :D

Don't worry about not playing the previous Bioshock's there isn't much to it that returns from the previosu games story wise. So if you haven't played the past Bioshock's you will be fine. the game is fantastic

Great game, great story. Wish you had more free will to make decisions. In the end I loved it, the ending blew my mind which is rare for a game story to do.

Just finished this and wow, anyone who doesn't have this game is missing out. Best story I've played since The Walking Dead, such a unique style of combat, and overall a really polished game. Only downside is that the last hour of the game throws so much at you that it's hard to take it all in. 9.5/10

Bioshock in my opinion is one of the best, if not THE BEST, single player ego shooter. The story is amazing and shackleing, the small details like the ingame audiotapes (audio diaries) telling you some additions and stories completing the experience. The gameplay is fluent and has a ballanced difficulty level. I really recommend this series (also the Bioshock book) and hope you enjoy it as much as I do/did.

Bioshock ist meines erachtens eines der besten, wenn nicht der beste, single player ego shooter. Die Geschichte ist umwerfend und fesselnd und die kleinen Details, wie die verstreuten Tonbänder (Audiotagebücher), die einem zusätzliche Randgeschichten erzählen oder tiefere Einblicke in die Gedanken und Psyche der Einwohner gewähren, vervollständigen die fabelhafte Spielerfahrung. Das Gameplay ist flüssig und hat ein gut ballanciertes Schwierigkeitsniveau. Ich möchte euch diese Serie wirklich empfehlen (auch das Bioshock Buch) und hoffe ihr genießt sie genau so, wie ich es tue/tat.

Wunderbares Game. Hätt ich nie gedacht. 
Ich bin selber eigentlich kein Ego Shooter Spieler, aber die Story hat mich an der Hand genommen und durch dieses Spiel geführt und ich habe vergessen, das ich einen Ego Shooter spiele. 

Nur zu empfehlen!

Good Story and Overall Gameplay was good.

The combat was much less stealth oriented than the first and second bioshock games, but it was still as fun as the first two. The system of weapons and character upgrades aren't anything we haven't seen before, but they definitely let you customize your play style. However, that is not the main reason why I consider this a great game. The atmosphere and story makes it, oh, so good. Its just, soo pretty. I can't stop looking at it (っ˘ڡ˘ς). The intense story, slowly revealing its mysteries to you one by one, with each one more shocking and mysterious than the previous one, will leave you wanting more. ლ(ಠ_ಠლ).So if you are a fan of a complicated, yet thought provoking story, this is the game for you. If not, its a fun shootem up game with lots of play style options. My only complaint is the ammo. And 1999. Oh, those good ol' times.

It was worth the wait. What an AMAZING game! I thought I would miss Rapture too much to enjoy Columbia. WRONG! Columbia is gorgeous. If it weren't populated by over zealous fanatics I would want to visit. This is the first I have experienced a FPS with a protagonist that talks to people, gives commentary, and we learn extensively about his history. Most FPS games that I play you are just a person running around with a gun assigned to shoot stuff. Elizabeth is one of the best sidekicks EVER. Another well fleshed out character. As a Christian, I wasn't offended at the blatant propanganda of the villain. It just showed how people use religion in order to have power over people. The game also gives a twist that you wouldnt guess in a million years. To tell you the truth, the big reveal annoyed the daylights out of me. It's a reveal that if you think about it too long, your head will hurt. Apart from that,  I really enjoyed the game.
10/10 yes very good

KEEP CALM AND HELP ELIZABETH !

Simply the most epic game ever! Worth ever penny!
awesome
Awesome.

Looks gorgeous, sounds amazing, walking around just takes your breath away. Good story too, even though some of the themes and motifs may make you feel uncomfortable. Elizabeth is well done. Vigours are a really fun way to off your enemies. Props for the first mainstream Steampunk game.

However, that's kind-of all there is to it. You enter an area, take all the coins and weapons and food, fight some enemies, go to the next area, take the coins and weapons and food, fight some enemies, go to the next area... etc etc. 

If they had sandboxed this game it would have been *amazing*. If they had put in crafting, skill trees, all the stuff a game like this needs in 2014, it would have been game of the year.  As it is, you're just watching a movie, and occasionally a mob of enemies appear and you have to shoot them. Um... 

So 100% for style and presentation, 50% for actual gameplay. So yes, recommended, but with reservations: if you like a linear first-person-shooter where you don't have to think much about puzzles or locations (a big arrow on the floor shows you where to go), then get this, it's beautiful and atmospheric and unique. If you like your games with a bit more.. interaction (Fallout, Deus EX, Dead Island etc) then you may feel a little let down by this.

(To be fair, games like Tomb Raider suffer from the same problem, guess they are written with consoles in mind or something. However, Tomb Raider, for all its restrictions, is practially an open world compared to this)

Excelent game I would reccomend it to anyone. Bioshock Infinite has the greatest storyline out of any game I have ever played. The game keeps you on the edge of your seat the whole time and the graphics are simply beautiful!

If you don't own this yet, RUN AWAY. Go play a fun game.

This one suffers from false complexity in the mechanics, lazy writing that rapidly just becomes bad, and absolutely no depth in any facet.

It's a gorgeous demonstration of modern graphical arts, but that even falls apart when the designers substitute enough flashing lights to kill a photo-sensitive epileptic for suspense, tension, and eery setting. No, seriously, I'm photo-sensitive, I have to take a break every few minutes after the mid-way point of the game.

Save your money, play something fun.
Coolist game I ever seen

Great game with great graphics, and a great story line. It's an FPS that doesn't overload you with constant fighting, it throws in some puzzles here and there and you sometimes have to backtrack a tad to figure out what you need to know... 10/10

This is a very good game.  The setting is amazing, the story is great, and Elizabeth is actually a very helpful AI companion.  I think I liked Rapture a bit better in terms of creepy setting but overall I think Bioshock Infinite is a great game and if you liked the first two Bioshock games you'll like this as well.

An amazingly immersive and well-made game all around.

Pros:
- Creative characters and setting
- Great voice acting
- Great music
- Solid graphics and art style (Elizabeth's subtle facial expressions are amazing)
- Perfectly responsive controls and comfy control scheme

Cons:
- The ending will leave you fuming if you dislike nihilism and/or like happy endings
- Yet another linear interactive movie of a game, like so many other AAA titles today, but an enjoyable one if you aren't zealously against this sort of thing
One of the best games I have ever played
Игра года, рекомендую!

WOW. What an amazing game. After some of the negative things I heard about this game I was worried it wouldn't meet my expectations. Now, after completing the story I have the utmost confidence in Irationals ability to weave an engrossing and complex tale worth any players time. If you haven't gotten around to playing the bioshock series, play it now. You won't regret it.
Эта игра великолепна.

BioShock Infinite is the third installment in the BioShock series. With a change of scenario from an underwater city to a floating one, you'll find many similarities from the previous games in this one, along with new mechanics inherited from Borderlands. This is not a bad thing, as it just adds to the gameplay.

The story is presented beautifully to the player, and progression goes smooth as you play. Not to mention the stunning graphics that will make you sigh in disbelief: Columbia is one hell of a scenery porn.


This is one of the best games I ever played, and I salute Irrational Games for this masterpiece. I cannot stress this enough: PLAY THIS FUCKING GAME.

Nada más empezar en la barca con esa entretenida conversa que oímos nos introduce al juego de la manera más dulce posible. La ciudad Columbia, nos adentra en ese mundo de la manera más espectacular. Y Elisabeth... Oh... Que ersonaje más entrañable. No parece un videojuego. Parece que estemos allí con ella. Ella está viva. Pero no sólo eso, nos ayuda, nos guía en esta aventura y finalmente la queremos.

La historia es la más original que he visto en mucho tiempo. Pudiendo competir de tu a tu con otros géneros como es el cine, series, libros, u otros videojuegos. 
La parte para mí más importante y que algunos parecen descuidar es que es muy divertido. No cansa para nada, y siempre quieres más. 

PD: Me lo he pasado offline en mi pueblo y no se me han registrado las horas de juego. 

Otros juegos me producen cansancio, éste no. 
El sistema de combate está muy mejorado respecto a los anteriores bioshock. Puedes combinar todas tus armas y vigorizantes como más te plazca. 
Sin duda alguna ha sido lo mejor para finalizar este año ( para mí ). Un juegazo como pocos los hay. Y me gustaría decir además, que no rejuego los videojuegos que me paso desde que dejé de ser un crío ( por tiempo, ganas, otros juegos) 
pero este, es el único que me han dado unas ganas terribles de rejugarlo para entender más esa compleja historia que me ha dejado boquiabierto.

Easily one of the best series of all time. If you still haven't played the whole Bioshock series you are truely missing out on one of the greatest video game stories ever made. 10/10

When I was reading the tons of reviews out there, my expectations were raised like... a LOT! There are a couple of things what I expect from a good game: a compelling story, a vivid gameplay and a lot of fun. Nowadays people require also a stunning, state of the art graphic. Frankly, it doesn't matter that much to me. I recently played some quite mind blowing indie games were graphics reminds me on the good old days back in the 90s. Plus, in other FPS like BioShock Infinite I decreased the graphic effects to a minimum to get a better sight on what matters: the enemy. But to make long story short, IMHO the pros and cons about this game:

[b]Pros:[/b]
- topsy-turvy world that looks simply fantastic
- the vigors are well chosen and even more the combos are awesome
- a variety of weapons which are quite well balanced
- Riding on the Sky-Line and kick ass is so much fun, not speaking of the different ways to frag someone
- Sky-hook! where can I buy a replica, dude?
- overall the battles feels really smooth and if action is going on it makes a lot of fun

[b]Neutral:[/b]
- the story is … well, weird I think. People stated that it’s actually phenomenal in every way. Maybe for a shooter, it might be true but its kinda confusing especially in the end. I won't say the story is bad or something, just it could be more deeply told. 

[b]Cons:[/b]
- Within less than 15 hours I played the game through on the second highest difficulty level, collecting most of the voxophone and kinetoscope, plus reaching more than 50 percent of the achievements. Personally, the play time is to short but there are some DLCs out there 

[b]Conclusion:[/b]
Got entertained for a while! 
My rate: 7/10
